problem_text: If T is a countable theory, does there exist a model A of T such that the theory of Aut (A) is undecidable? M. Giraudet, A. M. W. Glass
answer: Yes, moreover, every first order theory having infinite models has a model whose automorphism group has undecidable existential theory (V. V. Bludov, M. Giraudet, A. M. W. Glass, G. Sabbagh, in Models, Modules and Abelian Groups, de Gruyter, Berlin, 2008, 325–328).
